div.p: The grace of the Almighty be with us through Jesus Christ. Amen.

You should not think, most beloved lord and brother, that I have forgotten you, even though I have not written for some time. I am caught in many tribulations: my son Jonas has passed away in God; after the death of my most gracious lord, Elector Ottheinrich, Count Palatine, I suffer such compulsion from many godless people that I have finally decided to sell all my possessions and leave this land.
I ask you in brotherly faithfulness to give me guidance on where and in which place I might buy a property for 6, 7, or 8000 florins and settle with my wife and children.

All my persecution comes from the wretched sacrament dispute, which becomes more harmful and burdensome the longer it lasts; indeed, we are all preparing for a new miserable papacy. Write back to me with this messenger; he will return to Freiburg, but the letters can be delivered to me from there.
The priests here are in great preparation; it is to be feared that an uprising will follow. They are difficult and venomous.
It would be nice if we could become neighbors and not live far from each other. Given in all haste in Freiburg on the 9th of March in the year 1560.
Georg Fr√∂lich from Lemnitz in Schlachtegkh, etc. Greet all dear lords and brothers most highly and from the heart.
There is a new pasquinade written about the new pope; if it could come to print, it would be a pleasure and benefit to the truth and all the pious. Let me know your thoughts.
To Master Heinrich Bullinger, overseer of the church in Zurich, my especially dear lord and friend, to be delivered. Zurich.
